text: The principles which we have now stated are by no means alien to common
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: apprehension: they are not absolutely hidden, perhaps, from any one, but
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: are commonly seen through a mist. We might have presented the latter
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: part of them in a phraseology in which they would have seemed the most
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: familiar of truisms: we might have cautioned inquirers against too
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: extensive _generalization_, and reminded them that there are _exceptions_
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: to all rules. Such is the current language of those who distrust
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: comprehensive thinking, without having any clear notion why or where it
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: ought to be distrusted. We have avoided the use of these expressions
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: purposely, because we deem them superficial and inaccurate. The error,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: when there is error, does _not_ arise from generalizing too extensively;
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: that is, from including too wide a range of particular cases in a single
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: proposition. Doubtless, a man often asserts of an entire class what is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: only true of a part of it; but his error generally consists not in making
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: too wide an assertion, but in making the wrong _kind_ of assertion: he
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: predicated an actual result, when he should only have predicated a
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: _tendency_ to that result--a power acting with a certain intensity in that
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: direction. With regard to _exceptions_; in any tolerably ably advanced
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: science there is properly no such thing as an exception. What is thought
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: to be an exception to a principle is always some other and distinct
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: principle cutting into the former: some other force which impinges against
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the first force, and deflects it from its direction. There are not a _law_
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: and an _exception_ to that law--the law acting in ninety-nine cases, and
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the exception in one. There are two laws, each possibly acting in the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: whole hundred cases, and bringing about a common effect by their conjunct
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: operation. If the force which, being the less conspicuous of the two, is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: called the disturbing force, prevails sufficiently over the other force
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: in some one case, to constitute that case what is commonly called an
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: exception, the same disturbing force probably acts as a modifying cause
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: in many other cases which no one will call exceptions.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: Thus if it were stated to be a law of nature, that all heavy bodies fall
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: to the ground, it would probably be said that the resistance of the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: atmosphere, which prevents a balloon from falling, constitutes the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: balloon an exception to that pretended law of nature. But the real law
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: is, that all heavy bodies _tend_ to fall; and to this there is no
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: exception, not even the sun and moon; for even they, as every astronomer
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: knows, tend towards the earth, with a force exactly equal to that with
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: which the earth tends towards them. The resistance of the atmosphere
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: might, in the particular case of the balloon, from a misapprehension of
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: what the law of gravitation is, be said to _prevail_ over the law; but
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: its disturbing effect is quite as real in every other case, since though
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: it does not prevent, it retards the fall of all bodies whatever. The
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: rule, and the so-called exception, do not divide the cases between them;
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: each of them is a comprehensive rule extending to all cases. To call one
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of these concurrent principles an exception to the other, is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: superficial, and contrary to the correct principles of nomenclature and
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: arrangement. An effect of precisely the same kind, and arising from the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: same cause, ought not to be placed in two different categories, merely
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: as there does or does not exist another cause preponderating over it.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: It is only in art, as distinguished from science, that we can with
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: propriety speak of exceptions. Art, the immediate end of which is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: practice, has nothing to do with causes, except as the means of bringing
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: about effects. However heterogeneous the causes, it carries the effects
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of them all into one single reckoning, and according as the sum-total is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: _plus_ or _minus_, according as it falls above or below a certain line,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: Art says, Do this, or Abstain from doing it. The exception does not run
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: by insensible degrees into the rule, like what are called exceptions in
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: science. In a question of practice it frequently happens that a certain
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: thing is either fit to be done, or fit to be altogether abstained from,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: there being no medium. If, in the majority of cases, it is fit to be
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: done, that is made the rule. When a case subsequently occurs in which
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the thing ought not to be done, an entirely new leaf is turned over; the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: rule is now done with, and dismissed: a new train of ideas is introduced,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: between which and those involved in the rule there is a broad line of
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: demarcation; as broad and _tranchant_ as the difference between Ay and
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: No. Very possibly, between the last case which comes within the rule and
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the first of the exception, there is only the difference of a shade: but
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: that shade probably makes the whole interval between acting in one way
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: and in a totally different one. We may, therefore, in talking of art,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: unobjectionably speak of the _rule_ and the _exception_; meaning by the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: rule, the cases in which there exists a preponderance, however slight,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of inducements for acting in a particular way; and by the exception, the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: cases in which the preponderance is on the contrary side.

text: NOTES:
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy

text: [8] We say, the _production_ and _distribution_, not, as is usual with
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: writers on this science, the production, distribution, and _consumption_.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: For we contend that Political Economy, as conceived by those very
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: writers, has nothing to do with the consumption of wealth, further than
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: as the consideration of it is inseparable from that of production, or
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: from that of distribution. We know not of any _laws_ of the _consumption_
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of wealth as the subject of a distinct science: they can be no other
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: than the laws of human enjoyment. Political economists have never treated
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of consumption on its own account, but always for the purpose of the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: inquiry in what manner different kinds of consumption affect the production
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: and distribution of wealth. Under the head of Consumption, in professed
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: treatises on the science, the following are the subjects treated of: 1st,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: The distinction between _productive_ and _unproductive_ consumption; 2nd,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: The inquiry whether it is possible for _too much_ wealth to be _produced_,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: and for too great a portion of what has been produced to be applied to the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: purpose of further _production_; 3rd, The theory of taxation, that is to
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: say, the following two questions--by whom each particular tax is paid
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: (a question of _distribution_), and in what manner particular taxes affect
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: _production_.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: [9] The physical laws of the production of useful objects are all
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: equally presupposed by the science of Political Economy: most of them,
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: however, it presupposes in the gross, seeming to say nothing about them.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: A few (such, for instance, as the decreasing ratio in which the produce
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of the soil is increased by an increased application of labour) it is
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: obliged particularly to specify, and thus seems to borrow those truths
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: from the physical sciences to which they properly belong, and include
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: them among its own.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: [10] The _science_ of legislation is an incorrect and misleading
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: expression. Legislation is _making laws_. We do not talk of the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: _science_ of _making_ anything. Even the _science of government_ would
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: be an objectionable expression, were it not that _government_ is often
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: loosely taken to signify, not the act of governing, but the state or
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: condition of _being governed_, or of living under a government. A
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: preferable expression would be, the science of _political society_; a
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: principal branch of the more extensive science of society, characterized
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: in the text.
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: [11] One of the strongest reasons for drawing the line of separation
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: clearly and broadly between science and art is the following:--That the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: principle of classification in science most conveniently follows the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: classification of _causes_, while arts must necessarily be classified
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: according to the classification of the _effects_, the production of
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: which is their appropriate end. Now an effect, whether in physics or
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: morals, commonly depends upon a concurrence of causes, and it frequently
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: happens that several of these causes belong to different sciences. Thus
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: in the construction of engines upon the principles of the science of
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: _mechanics_, it is necessary to bear in mind the _chemical_ properties
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of the material, such as its liability to oxydize; its electrical and
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: magnetic properties, and so forth. From this it follows that although
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the necessary foundation of all art is science, that is, the knowledge
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: of the properties or laws of the objects upon which, and with which, the
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: art dons its work; it is not equally true that every art corresponds to
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: one particular science. Each art presupposes, not one science, but
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: science in general; or, at least, many distinct sciences.

text: These five essays represent Mill's earliest thoughts on economic matters
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: and were first composed in 1829 and 1830 before his reputation had been
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: established by the publication of _Logic_ in 1843. Their successful
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: reception no doubt hastened the composition of his comprehensive work
title: Essays on some unsettled Questions of Political Economy
author: Mill, John Stuart

text: the _Principles of Political Economy_ (1848).
